intro: Anneslia haematocephala, commonly known as the blood-headed anneslia, is a striking flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant red bracts that resemble a crown of blood. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Anneslia haematocephala is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its dramatic and eye-catching appearance.
